abstract: By indicating typical characteristics of certain areas of law, it seems that we are able to indicate some ideal preferences that persons that are engaged in such have or should have. Moreover, when some specific characteristics are emphasized as typical, and if as such they have been proved historically as important for the well-functioning of a legal field, then such can be called preferred or even ideal. Thus, in this article, I am trying to indicate those preferences in lawyers psychological types that make them good lawyers generally, and also specifically regarding their special area of interest within law.
title: LAWYERS' IDEAL PSYCHOLOGICAL TYPE PREFERENCES
subject: law
